de.unisiegen.tpml.core.prettyprinter
Class DefaultPrettyString

java.lang.Object
  de.unisiegen.tpml.core.prettyprinter.DefaultPrettyString
All Implemented Interfaces:
PrettyString
final class DefaultPrettyString
extends Object
implements PrettyString

Default implementation of the PrettyString interface. Generated by the DefaultPrettyStringBuilders.

Version:
$Rev: 277 $
Author:
Benedikt Meurer
See Also:
PrettyAnnotation, PrettyCharIterator, PrettyString, PrettyStringBuilder, DefaultPrettyStringBuilder

Constructor Summary
DefaultPrettyString(String content, Map<PrettyPrintable,PrettyAnnotation> annotations, PrettyStyle[] styles)
          Allocates a new DefaultPrettyString for the specified content.
 
Method Summary
 boolean equals(Object obj)
          Returns true if the obj is a DefaultPrettyString with the same attribute values as this pretty string instance.
 PrettyAnnotation getAnnotationForPrintable(PrettyPrintable printable)
          Looks up the PrettyAnnotation for the given printable in this pretty string.
 Collection<PrettyAnnotation> getAnnotations()
          Returns the list of annotations contained within the pretty string.
 int hashCode()
          Returns a hash value for this pretty string.
 PrettyCharIterator toCharacterIterator()
          Returns an PrettyCharIterator which can be used to iterate over the characters contained within the pretty string and extract certain informations (like style) about the characters.
 String toString()
          Returns the string representation of the pretty string without any annotations.

Constructor Detail

DefaultPrettyString

DefaultPrettyString(String content,
                    Map<PrettyPrintable,PrettyAnnotation> annotations,
                    PrettyStyle[] styles)
Allocates a new DefaultPrettyString for the specified content. The annotations and styles give additional information about the data contained in of content.

Parameters:
content - the string representation of an expression.
annotations - the annotations within content.
styles - a map, which specifies for each character in content the PrettyStyle to use.
See Also:
DefaultPrettyStringBuilder.toPrettyString()
Method Detail

getAnnotations

public Collection<PrettyAnnotation> getAnnotations()
Returns the list of annotations contained within the pretty string.

Specified by:
getAnnotations in interface PrettyString
Returns:
the annotations contained within the pretty string.
See Also:
PrettyString.getAnnotations()

getAnnotationForPrintable

public PrettyAnnotation getAnnotationForPrintable(PrettyPrintable printable)
                                           throws IllegalArgumentException
Looks up the PrettyAnnotation for the given printable in this pretty string. If no annotation is associated with printable (that is, printable is not present in the pretty string), an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

Specified by:
getAnnotationForPrintable in interface PrettyString
Parameters:
printable - a PrettyPrintable instance, which is valid for the pretty string.
Returns:
the annotation for printable.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the printable is invalid for the pretty string.
See Also:
PrettyString.getAnnotationForPrintable(PrettyPrintable)

toCharacterIterator

public PrettyCharIterator toCharacterIterator()
Returns an PrettyCharIterator which can be used to iterate over the characters contained within the pretty string and extract certain informations (like style) about the characters.

Specified by:
toCharacterIterator in interface PrettyString
Returns:
the character iterator for the pretty string.
See Also:
PrettyString.toCharacterIterator()

toString

public String toString()
Returns the string representation of the pretty string without any annotations. This is mainly useful for debugging purposes.

Specified by:
toString in interface PrettyString
Overrides:

Returns:
